title: Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez to join Bayern Munich? Transfer news and gossip from Tuesday's papers
text:
Sport Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez to join Bayern Munich? Transfer news and gossip from Tuesday's papers PLUS: The Gunners are lining up Petr Cech's replacement AND Barcelona have a plan to snare Philippe Coutinho Share Arsenal's Alexis Sanchez could be off to Bayern Munich (Photo: PA) Share Get football   
Alexis Sanchez is one of two players at the head of Bayern Munich's summer wish list. 
The Chilean's time at Arsenal will almost certainly be up at the end of the season and Spanish outlet Sport say a move to Bavaria is on the cards. 
It is claimed that the German champions are keen to land both Sanchez, 28, and Real Madrid's James Rodriguez, 25, who Bayern boss Carlo Ancelotti signed for Madrid in 2014. 
Sanchez's contract at Arsenal expires at the end of next campaign and the Gunners could be forced to sell him this summer or face losing him on a free. Top stories from Tuesday's Mirror 
TRANSFERS EXCLUSIVE - Chelsea are bracing themselves for a summer-long battle with Real Madrid over Eden Hazard. The Premier League champions-elect have so far rejected any approach from the Spanish club for their Belgian winger. But Real believe Hazard is interested in finally working with head coach Zinedine Zidane after five years at Stamford Bridge. The 26-year-old is also understood to be learning Spanish, and Chelsea are refusing to comment publicly on claims they promised Hazard to consider any offer from the Bernabeu for his services. Eden Hazard is being eyed by Real Madrid (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Southampton are preparing a £20million bid for Anfield bad-boy Mamadou Sakho. The out-of-favour Liverpool defender has impressed during a loan period with Crystal Palace, with the Londoners keeping clean sheets in all three games he’s played. However, Palace don’t have an option to buy in the agreement which will keep him at Selhurst Park until the end of the season. Manchester City winger Jesus Navas is a summer target for Spain's Sevilla, the club he left for the Blues four years ago. 
OTHER NEWS Everton are confident Seamus Coleman will make it back from his career-threatening double-leg break. The Toffees' Republic of Ireland international defender is highly unlikely to play again in 2017 after his tibia and fibia were snapped in a sickening tackle by Wales’ Neil Taylor during a World Cup qualifier on Friday night. Seamus Coleman is facing a lengthy spell out but Everton are confident he will return to full fitness (Photo: REUTERS) 
Coleman could be out for a full year, but that is seen as good news by his club amid fears that the injury was so severe it could have prevented him from ever kicking a ball in anger again. The best-case scenario would see him sidelined for seven to nine months. Transfer news from other newspapers and websites Barcelona could offer Ivan Rakitic to Liverpool as a makeweight in their bid to sign Philippe Coutinho (Don Balon) Monaco starlet Tiemoue Bakayoko turned down a move to Arsenal last year (France Football) Arsenal want to sign Rui Patricio, the Sporting Lisbon goalkeeper, as a replacement for Petr Cech (RMC) Like us on Facebook
